text: @eid_8e2042d2 created this channel on 2026-04-30 00:00:00. This is the very beginning of the planning-TableauAnomalyDetection channel.

Hi team, I want to discuss the Product Requirements Document for TableauAnomalyDetection. Let's brainstorm some ideas and outline the key sections we need to include. ğŸ˜Š
Hey @eid_3b36c220, sounds good! I think we should start with defining the core functionalities. What exactly do we want our anomaly detection to achieve?
Agreed, George. We should also consider the types of data it will handle and any specific algorithms we plan to use. @eid_3b36c220, any thoughts on that?
Great points, @eid_86044ae5 and @eid_12f75faa. Let's ensure we cover user alerts and notifications for detected anomalies. Also, how about a section on integration with existing Tableau features?
I can take the lead on drafting the integration section. We should highlight how seamless it will be for users to incorporate this into their current workflows. ğŸš€
For QA, we need to outline testing strategies. @eid_104b8b57 and I can work on defining test cases for different data scenarios. @eid_9fecc161, want to join us?
Count me in, Bob! We should also think about edge cases and how the system handles them. @eid_9fecc161, your thoughts?
Absolutely, I'm on board. Let's ensure we have a robust plan for both functional and non-functional testing. ğŸ”

From a UX perspective, we need to focus on how users will interact with anomaly alerts. I'll draft some user journey maps and share them for feedback. @eid_3b36c220, any specific user personas we should consider?
Thanks, Fiona! Let's focus on data analysts and business users as our primary personas. They will benefit the most from timely anomaly detection.
I'll help with the user journey maps too. We should ensure the alerts are intuitive and actionable. Maybe we can add a section on user feedback mechanisms?
Good idea, Emma! Feedback loops will be crucial for continuous improvement. ğŸ‘

For deadlines, how about we aim to have the first draft ready by next Friday? That gives us a week to refine before our next meeting.
